intro: Syzygium guillauminii, commonly known as the Illawarra flamewood, is a small to medium-sized evergreen tree native to eastern Australia. It is characterized by its striking red to orange-pink flowers that appear in late summer to early autumn. The plant has smooth, greyish bark that peels in thin strips, and its leaves are glossy, lance-shaped, and dark green. It thrives in coastal and sandy soils, often forming dense thickets in sheltered areas. Syzygium guillauminii is an important component of the Illawarra region’s native vegetation and provides habitat for various wildlife species.
